questions.question: The sides of two similar triangles are in the ratio 3:5. If the area of the smaller triangle is 27 sq. cm, find the area of the larger triangle.
questions.explanation: Ratio of areas of similar triangles = (ratio of sides)² ⇒ (3/5)² = 9/25 ⇒ Area₂ = (25/9) × 27 = 75 sq. cm.

questions.question: A square and a circle have equal perimeters. Find the ratio of the area of the square to that of the circle. (Take π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Let side of square = a, radius of circle = r. Then 4a = 2πr ⇒ a = (πr)/2 ⇒ Areas ratio = a² : πr² = (π²r²/4) : πr² = 4 : π.

A circle is inscribed in an equilateral triangle of side 12 cm. Find the area of the circle. (Take √3 = 1.732 and π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Radius of inscribed circle in equilateral triangle = (√3/6) × a = (1.732/6) × 12 = 3.464 cm. Area = πr² = 3.14 × (3.464)² = 3.14 × 12 = 37.68 ≈ 30.2 sq. cm (approx rounding).

questions.question: The base of a triangle is 10 cm more than its height. If the area of the triangle is 300 sq. cm, find its base and height.
questions.explanation: Area = ½ × base × height = 300 ⇒ base × height = 600 ⇒ (h + 10)h = 600 ⇒ h² + 10h − 600 = 0 ⇒ h = 20 ⇒ base = 30 cm.
